{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3479389,"name":"Laurens Schunk","username":"LaurensSchunk","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/54ee81/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-11T20:33:52.092Z","cooked":"

Hi,

Whenever I try to deploy my code, the task discoverroborio fails. This only occurs on my Mac (MacOS Sequoia 15.2), and works on everyone else’s computer. This is also a new issue and did not occur before I updated to 2025 WPILib. We are using a roborio 1, imaged to the latest version (v2.0). Below is the error I see:

> Task :discoverroborio
Discovering Target roborio
admin @ 10.22.40.2: Resolved but not connected.
  Reason: RuntimeException
  org.apache.sshd.common.SshException: DefaultConnectFuture[admin@/10.22.40.2:22]: Failed (NoRouteToHostException) to execute: No route to host
admin @ 172.22.11.2: Resolved but not connected.
  Reason: TimeoutException
  Discovery timed out.
admin @ roborio-2240-FRC.local: Resolved but not connected.
  Reason: RuntimeException
  org.apache.sshd.common.SshException: DefaultConnectFuture[admin@/10.22.40.2:22]: Failed (NoRouteToHostException) to execute: No route to host
admin @ roborio-2240-FRC.lan: Failed resolution.
  Reason: RuntimeException
  Unknown Host
admin @ roborio-2240-FRC: Failed resolution.
  Reason: RuntimeException
  Unknown Host
admin @ roborio-2240-FRC.frc-field.local: Failed resolution.
  Reason: RuntimeException
  Unknown Host
1 other action(s) not started.
Run with --info for more details


> Task :discoverroborio FAILED
Missing Target!
=============================================
Are you connected to the robot, and is it on?
=============================================
GradleRIO detected this build failed due to not being able to find "roborio"!
Scroll up in this error log for more information.

FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

* What went wrong:
Execution failed for task ':discoverroborio'.
> A failure occurred while executing edu.wpi.first.deployutils.deploy.target.discovery.TargetDiscoveryWorker
   > Target roborio could not be found at any location! See above for more details.

* Try:
> Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace.
> Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.
> Run with --scan to get full insights.
> Get more help at https://help.gradle.org.

BUILD FAILED in 7s
4 actionable tasks: 1 executed, 3 up-to-date

Other info:

  • I can still ssh into the robot and ping it just fine.
  • The Roborio address is static.
  • Visual studio code has permission to access devices on the local network.
  • The team number has been set in WPILib

I have already tried:

  • reinstalling WPILib
  • restarting computer
  • restarting robot

Can you deploy from other machines? I’ve seen similar behavior with a roborio out of date but that doesn’t seem like your issue. Did you format it with the 2025 image or just update the firmware?

Can you ssh from the VS Code terminal? What is the IP address of your computer?

Do you have multiple versions of VS Code installed?

Other machines are able to deploy to the robot. I am also able to deploy from outside of VScode. It seems to be an issue with that. I am not sure what settings I need to adjust to make it work.

gradlew.bat deploy

A fellow mentor found this and it fixed our problem!

stackoverflow.com

VSCode Remote SSH - failed: Error: No route to host

visual-studio-code, raspberry-pi, vscode-remote, vscode-remote-ssh
asked by Adithya on 05:02PM - 29 Sep 24 UTC

Just do

Settings>Privacy & Security>Local Network and allow VS Code

Unfortunately, this did not work for me.

I have found a workaround:
I open a terminal (outside of VS Code) and cd into the project. I can then run ./gradlew deploy and deploy the code to the robot.

I believe that the issue is that the VS Code app is not in the applications directory, but I cannot move it there because a lot of it’s function comes from it’s position relative to the rest of the wpilib directory.
